page.title: 17FARMS - MARTON & NUNTHORPE
page.content: Machinery used on Bonny Grove Farm includes tractors, ploughs, drills, balers, combine harvesters and trailers. Chemical sprayers spray weed and insect killer. In winter Highland cattle come down for winter grazing. There are 25 hens, the eggs feed the family.{Upsall Grange Farm}consists of 210 acres of grassland and 60 acres of nonproductive land. 140 Friesian cattle, 140 young Friesian cows and 1 Hereford bull are kept on the farm together with 30 orphan lambs which use up the spare milk because of reduced Common Market quotas. 25% of the stock is replaced every year. The farmer, his wife, a labourer and a student are the workforce. Winter feed for the cattle is silage. Each cow produces 52-56 pints of milk a day. 64 cows are milked in an hour by vacuum powered milking apparatus.
